issues.description: HTTP method for creating a Person is inconsistent between the problem statement and the implementation in the solution. The problem statement explicitly lists POST /persons as the create endpoint (problem expects students to implement a POST). The solution (both server-side PersonResource and client-side PersonController) implements the create endpoint with HTTP PUT to /persons. This mismatch will confuse students: they will implement a POST create request following the task description, but the provided solution and example client use PUT, causing the client and server to disagree about the correct verb and breaking compatibility if students follow the instructions literally.
issues.suggested_fix:
Make the create-person HTTP verb consistent across problem statement, template, and solution. Prefer the conventional REST approach (POST for create) and update the solution and client to use POST, or update the problem statement to require PUT if PUT is intentional. Concretely (recommended):
- Change the server mapping in PersonResource to @PostMapping("persons") for the createPerson method.
- Change the client code in PersonController.addPerson(...) to use webClient.post().uri("persons") instead of webClient.put().uri("persons").
- Update any documentation in the problem statement that lists the endpoints so it matches the chosen verb (POST recommended). This keeps the API semantics consistent and avoids student confusion.
